ai.summary: An 8.6 km moderate circular hike through Lanhydrock Parkland, near the National Trust estate in Cornwall, England. The route weaves through formal gardens, shaded woodlands, and river meadows, with gentle hills and scenic viewpoints suitable for steady walkers seeking a varied countryside experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed surface trails including gravel and tarmac paths, grassy loops, and occasional tree-root exposed sections. Expect a few gentle ascents and descents, with wetter, muddier conditions after rain. Trails are well-marked within the parkland and generally suitable for standard hiking footwear.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast before you go. Wear sturdy footwear and bring layers for changing conditions. Trails can be wet and uneven, so proceed with care, especially after rain. Stay on marked paths, be mindful of other walkers and cyclists, and keep dogs under control. Carry water and snacks, and let someone know your planned route and return time. Mobile reception may be limited in parts of the park.
recommended_gear: Map or offline navigation device / fully charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for favorable weather and scenery; hikers can enjoy year-round visits with proper gear and prepared for cooler, wetter conditions in winter.

seo.title: Lanhydrock Parkland Walk – 8.6 km Moderate Hike in Cornwall, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore an 8.6 km moderate hike through Lanhydrock Parkland, Cornwall. Discover parkland paths, woodlands, and river meadows with varied terrain and scenic views.
